summary: In response to COVID-19 , Congress created the Paycheck Protection Program to help small businesses get forgivable loans. But self-employed people and businesses owned by minorities, women, and veterans initially faced challenges getting loans. We testified that these challenges prompted Congress and the Small Business Administration to: Approve 600 new lenders—including nonbanks, who largely didn't participate in the first round of the program Develop guidance...
title: Paycheck Protection Program: Program Changes Increased Lending to Smaller and Underserved Businesses
